definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: This is the ancient origins of the rise of Buddhism and Taoism in the pre-existing folk activities.
sentences.chinese: 這是源流古者在佛道教興起前就有的民俗活動。

sentences.english: "city god"), a deity in Chinese Daoist mythology who is responsible for the affairs of the city.
sentences.chinese: 城隍是中國道教神話中守護城池的神明。

sentences.english: If it is referring to the Shinto shrine, then known as the Torii gate.
sentences.chinese: 如果是指神道教的神社的話，那個門叫做鳥居。

sentences.english: There were many Taoist sects in the T'ang Dynasty, in which, the Shangqing Sect had the most important influence.
sentences.chinese: 在唐代衆多的道教派別中，上清派的影響最大。

sentences.english: Taoism has its beginning in Han-Wei-Jin period.
sentences.chinese: 漢魏晉乃道教開端的時代。

sentences.english: The Quanzhen authentic rhyming is music used by Quanzhen School of Taoism.
sentences.chinese: 全真正韻是道教全真教派使用的音樂。

sentences.english: The Taoist aesthetic is the most important subsidiary current in Chinese traditional aesthetic cultural river system.
sentences.chinese: 道教審美文化是中國傳統審美文化河系的重要支流。

sentences.english: The supernatural and wonderful Wuyi Mountains was called"the sixteenth fairyland"by Taoism.
sentences.chinese: 武夷山鍾靈毓秀，被道教尊奉爲“第十六小洞天”。

sentences.english: So Mr. Lu Xun says, China roots in taoism.
sentences.chinese: 所以魯迅先生才說，中國的根底在道教。

sentences.english: The project is located in Anhui province, in one of the 5 sacred Taoist mountain of China.
sentences.chinese: 該項目位於安徽省天柱山，是中國5個道教名山之一。

sentences.english: In this part, the relationship of Xiaojingwei and Taoism had been discussed too.
sentences.chinese: 同時本章對緯書篇名與道教關係也進行了部分論述。

sentences.english: Japan is a Shinto faith basis for the country and people.
sentences.chinese: 日本是一個以神道教爲信仰基礎的國家和民族。

sentences.english: In fact, the Daoists were likely right that the brain is the key.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，道教可能是對的，大腦是關鍵。

sentences.english: Lastly, it simply analyzed the reason why Taoism should choose Laozi as the founder instead of King Huang.
sentences.chinese: 最後討論了道教放棄黃帝而選擇老子作爲教主的原因。

sentences.english: We all know that you are interested in Taoism , so what's your opinion to eastern philosophy?
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道你對道教很感興趣，你怎麼看東方哲學？

definition: Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
to believe in (a deity or other supernatural being)/to worship
Way of the Five Pecks of Rice (Taoist movement)/Way of the Celestial Master
arts of healing, divination, horoscope etc/supernatural arts (old)
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
the three gods in charge of heaven, earth and water (Daoism)
